These logs are only present in NM. ( It does not show up in AM log) 
These stacktraces are in WARN or INFO level. Ideally, exception should be printed in ERROR log level.
fields.summary: Nodemanager logs failed to download file with INFO level

comments.body:
We can not aggregate this error message to app logs due to race condition of the error occurs before AM container starts.

The first error could occur when node manager is disk full or yarn local directory is setup with wrong permission or bad disk. From system administrator point of view, it is safer to log this message with ERROR level because system administrator might want to check this to make sure cluster is not misconfigure. However, this log entry could also be noise because user error in referencing file name can also trigger this error message to show up.

The second message can be left in warn state without being aggregated because both messages are tracing back to the same root cause that node manager is unable to download file for a container.

{quote}These logs are only present in NM. ( It does not show up in AM log)
{quote}
Are we going to address this too in this JIRA? It's very difficult to debug this from the app's perspective.

I think the string "{{org.apache.hadoop.yarn.exceptions.YarnException: Download and unpack failed}}" will be in the app diagnostics, because it's the exception message, but the key error to surface is this "{{Caused by: java.io.FileNotFoundException: /grid/0/hadoop/yarn/local/filecache/28_tmp/InputDir/input1.txt (Permission denied)}}".
[~vinodkv] Yes.  This will be added to the diagnostics in the next patch.
Patch 002 has been updated to send diagnostic information to AM.  The screenshot shows what it looks like.

[~vinodkv], publicRsrc does not trigger notification to application master.  It only logs in node manager log file.  This is the reason that a new instance of LocalResourceTracker was setup to send information to application master.
